alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 2:25AM CDT until August 22 at 4:30AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR DALLAS COUNTY... At 225 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms continue to producing very heavy rain across Dallas County, especially near downtown Dallas. Radar estimates and rain gauge measurements indicate up to 7 inches of rain have fallen in the past few hours, including DFW Airport which measured 6.46 inches of rain. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding due to heavy rainfall from thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dallas, Garland, Irving, Grand Prairie, Mesquite, Carrollton, Richardson, Lewisville, Flower Mound, Rowlett, Grapevine, Wylie, Coppell, Lancaster, Farmers Branch, Balch Springs, University Park, Sachse, Seagoville and Addison. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
